title: 148864029.dont Assume Specs
excerpt: One way to be bad at your job is to complete tasks the wrong way. Or, at least, not in the way your boss/colleagues/clients need you to.

children.text: One way to be bad at your job is to complete tasks the wrong way. Or, at least, not in the way your boss/colleagues/clients
And one easy way to do that is to assume you know the specs—even when you don’t—even when clarity is usually a question away.
Assuming the specs won’t win you any favors. Unless you enjoy doing more work and causing more headache in the long-run.
